oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from James B. Owen to his father
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Union soldier James B. Owen, private in Company D 31st Reg. Illinois Infantry to his father. He says he "has no knews of importance" to share, though he writes from camp 12 miles south of Oxford where they have taken several hundred prisoners.; A fact, which, he says "is nothing to cheer." He considers a possible engagement of troops coming soon and mentions his general, John A. Logan.
